title.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, June 6, 1919. Striking Overall-Workers Begin to Gain Their Victories

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, June 6, 1919. STRIKING OVERALL-WORKERS BEGIN TO GAIN THEIR VICTORIES

body.p: The 400 overall-makers, former members of Local 180, United Garment Workers, now affiliated with the Amalgamated, have but two days back gone out on strike for recognition of their union and for better working terms; and yesterday already marked the first of their victory when the firms of David Naner and the Chicago Overall Co., 702 W. 12th St., signed agreements with the Amalgamated ceding all demands.
